history.content:
If you are going to be doubling in STAT + LSCS (or LSCS alone), then your CS declaring GPA is depended on 61A + 61B + 70 ONLY. However, if you are not taking Math 55 for your back up major (possibly applied math and etc.) then it's highly recommended to directly self-study CS 70 since all the course material is open to all Berkeley students. It could saves you a great amount of time. 

ps: Probably data science could be a great back up option for you since you plan to double major in stat and CS. If that's the case, then I would like to say maybe taking STAT 134/140 prior to CS 70 would be a good idea because: 1) CS 70 is not a part of requirement for data science, 2) STAT 134/140 can fulfill data science upper requirement, 3) 134/140 may prepare you very well for the second half of 70 (the reverse is also true but if you don't declare CS in the end then see 1 & 2).

_____________________________________________________

I'd suggest you to take Stat 134/140 either before CS 70 or concurrently (this works because the probability portion of 70 is covered in the second half of the semester, and by then, you'd already be familiar with the material from 134). This course (+ adjunct) helped me get the grade I required for declaring and I would strongly suggest the same for you.

I will be a sophomore next semester intending to do CS + Statistics Double Major. As I am a little worried about the GPA cap for declaring CS major, I want to do some prep next semester for CS 70. Is it possible to take Math 55 (Maybe P/NP?) before CS 70 the next spring? If so, how is the declaration GPA calculated?


EDIT: I will definitely be taking 61B and Stat 134 next semester. Is it too hard to take 70 as well?

Thank you in advance!
